contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox astronaut | name =Charles Jones | image =Jones.charles.jpg | type =[[United States Air Force|USAF]] Astronaut | nationality =[[United States|American]] | birth_date = {{Birth date|1952|11|4}} | death_date = {{Death date and age|2001|9|11|1952|11|4}} | birth_place =[[Clinton, Indiana|Clinton]], [[Indiana]] | death_place =[[New York City|New York]], [[New York]] <br /> (onboard [[American Airlines Flight 11|AA Flight 11]]) |previous_occupation = [[computer programmer]] | rank =Colonel, USAF | selection =[[List of astronauts by selection#1982|1982 USAF Group]] | mission =None }} Colonel '''Charles Edward''' ("'''Chuck'''") '''Jones''' (November 4, 1952 – September 11, 2001) was a United States Air Force officer, a [[computer programmer]], and an astronaut in the USAF [[Manned Spaceflight Engineer Program]]. ==Biography== [[File:12.6.11CharlesEdwardJonesPanelN-74ByLuigiNovi1.jpg|thumb|left|Jones' name is located on Panel N-74 of the [[National September 11 Memorial]]â€™s North Pool, along with those of other passengers of Flight 11.]] Jones was born in [[Clinton, Indiana|Clinton]], [[Indiana]]. He graduated from [[Wichita High School East]] in 1970 and earned a bachelor of science in astronautical engineering from the [[United States Air Force Academy]] in 1974. He entered the USAF Manned Spaceflight Engineer program in 1982, and was scheduled to fly on mission [[Cancelled Shuttle missions|STS-71-B]] in December 1986, but the mission was cancelled after the [[Space Shuttle Challenger|''Challenger'' Disaster]] in January 1986. He left the Manned Spaceflight Engineer program in 1987. He was killed at the age of 48 in the [[September 11, 2001 attacks|attacks of September 11, 2001]], aboard [[American Airlines Flight 11]]. He had been living as a retired [[US Air Force]] Colonel in [[Bedford, Massachusetts|Bedford]], [[Massachusetts]], at the time of his death. He was survived by his wife Jeanette. At the [[National 9/11 Memorial]], Jones is memorialized at the North Pool, on Panel N-74.<ref>[http://names.911memorial.org/#lang=en_US&page=person&id=4423 Charles Edward Jones]. Memorial Guide: [[National 9/11 Memorial]].
